thread.title: iPhone 6s launch: Watch as new Apple smartphone and premium gadgets are unveiled
thread.title_full: iPhone 6s launch: Watch as new Apple smartphone and premium gadgets are unveiled - Mirror Online

author: Jon Livesey , Martyn Landi
title: iPhone 6s launch: Watch as new Apple smartphone and premium gadgets are unveiled
text:
Chances are, you haven't bagged an invitation to tonight's official launch of the latest Apple iPhone.
But that doesn't mean you won't be able follow all the action - because Mirror.co.uk is covering the event right here, from 7pm BST.
The latest iPhone - expected to be called the iPhone 6s , alongside the phablet-sized 6s Plus - will be debuted at a live event in California.
Apple CEO Tim Cook will deliver a keynote address and reveal the latest version of the tech giant's hugely popular iPhone gadget.
Justin Sullivan/Getty Images Unveiling: Apple CEO Tim Cook will deliver a keynote address at the launch event
This year, Apple sent out a bunch of invitations, which cryptically suggests you ask Siri for a hint .
If you ask the iPhone's digital assistant, it reveals there's a big event happening on Wednesday, September 9 .
The event will take place at the Bill Graham auditorium in San Francisco at 6pm UK time .
For those in California, it'll be happening at 10am.
C Flanigan/FilmMagic Venue: The launch will take place at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium in San Francisco
Apple will be providing a live stream of the event, but it will only be available to watch on Mac computers or iPhones and iPad mobile devices .
Mirror.co.uk will be running a stream 'as live' an hour behind.
Around 7,000 people are expected to attend the event - many of whom will be Apple employees.
As Apple logo banners and flags fly over the auditorium ahead of the launch event, new statistics reveal that Apple has sold enough iPhones since the phone launched in 2007 to supply a tenth of the world's population.
Apple will be looking to turn up the heat on their rivals, by repeating the success of last year's iPhone 6 launch, when the firm broke all their sales records, shifting more than four million in one day, and 70 million in the first three months.
Martin Hajek Upgrade: The iPhone 6s will look similar to the iPhone 6 - but the camera and battery will be better
The likes of Samsung, HTC, LG, Sony and Huawei have all made big pushes to follow this success, with no-one able to come close in an otherwise saturated market.
This year Apple is looking to appeal to consumers by introducing Force Touch - their pressure sensitive screen technology - to the iPhone for the first time.
There are also rumours of the phone coming in a rose gold finish for the first time.
Ahead of the event, research from survey firm OnePulse found that despite iPhone updates coming annually, 75% of Apple users were still excited about today's event.
The rumoured introduction of a rose gold iPhone could be crucial too, as 41% said that design and appearance is what they would be most interested in.
Beyond iPhones, Apple is reportedly set to unveil a revamped version of their Apple TV box, possibly with its own streaming service to rival Netflix , as well as a larger, more powerful iPad.
DailyMirror
